description:
I rarely dine in so this is based on my takeout experiences:

Good, solid, not too fancy Indian food.  Probably best Indian restaurant in the Noe Valley/Mission/Castro/Glen Park area.  Highlights are the saag paneer, the samosas, and the various naan.  The tandoori items tend to be a bit dry and once they got a little too aggressive with the meat tenderizer in my butter chicken.  But otherwise pretty solid.  They are very spice-forward, so don't expect too much delicate subtlety in some of the flavor profiles.
author: David O.

description: The food was yummy, the service was good and we really enjoyed the inteire experience! We ordered the clay meal for two (tasting menu style), it was A LOT of food but everything we had - maybe except for the hot pan with meats that were a bit dry for my taste - was very tasteful! We'll be back!
author: Stav F.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE.  

We live nearby, thought we would walk down from Bernal Hill to try it out.  

One guy was working the whole restaurant.  No other customers.  Guy took our order.  Then proceeded to take phone orders, which he went back and prepared and handed to the delivery guys before STARTING our order.  Must have been half an hour when he finally brought out our fried eggplant appetizer.  Huge.  Inedible.  Stinking of rancid oil.  We left it on the plate.  The waiter spent another half hour in the kitchen.  Finally, we asked him to cancel half of our dinner and bring us what was already prepared.  More than an hour after we entered this empty restaurant he brought us our fish tandoori and rice.  The fish was edible, though the oil was again bad.  Rice was OK.  I immediately asked for the bill when dinner arrived so we could escape.  When he brought the bill, it still had all the items that we previously canceled on it, so he had to redo the bill.  

I don't know how this place stays in business in the busy, competitive San Francisco restaurant scene.  Why didn't I do 3 minutes of research?  I'll never get that 90 minutes of my life back.  And for the first time in many, many years (10 years?  more?) I left no tip.
author: Greg S.

description:
The rice came super soggy. Like almost jook like (congee for non-Asians). The rice isn't the typical ones Indian restaurants give either. More like typical Chinese rice. And they topped it off with peas. Wtf.

CTM, the most basic item ever...is probably a two stars out of five. The rice was a killer though. Total $21 and some change. Never again.

Worst part is that I had it ordered so of course I can't send it back to the kitchen. Instead the rest lays in compost.
author: Whitne Y.

description:
Do not be surprised when you step in  there and you will be informed that the food take  10 minuets to be ready and after 15 minuets when you go to ask about it, they say another five minuets and after 5 minuets they  say another fives minuets! Then you never get your food .
If you are hungry do not think to go there .
author: Mo'ad A.

description: Empty for lunch midweek. The items on the lunch buffet struggled so hard to make an impression. It has been a while since I've had lackluster Indian food--the scene in SF is vibrant... but not here. Peace out.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description:
The staff and owner (I think he was the owner) here are the sweetest! My friends took me here for their buffet lunch on my birthday. The food was flavorful and they brought us endless amounts of naan. What really stood out was the fact that they made us feel like we were eating in our own family's home. They kept encouraging us to keep eating and were showing us videos of an American actress who does Punjabi performances. 

My friends and I couldn't stop talking about what a pleasant experience we had here. We'll be back!!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Super bland. We got the veggie fried rice and mushroom and peas (both seemed like canned veggies). It was the only restaurant on Doordash late at night with vegan options. Never again!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I have eaten at this Clay Oven several times. 90% of the time it's really good but tonight was different. I ordered the chicken tikka masalla and onion naan and could not be more disappointed. The chicken was burnt and and there was no heat spiceness to it. The entire order tasted burnt. The onion naan turned out to be garlic nan and was not edible.
I'm not sure that I will return.   :-(
author: Brian M.

description: Our flight was delayed by 2 hours from LA and we reached SFO at around 10 pm. This was the only Indian restaurant open till 11 pm. Thats the primary reason for giving it 4 stars. Food was good too. I would like to visit this place again.
author: Saurabh M.

description:
I put in an order for delivery around 630 and it's now 8:30 and I still haven't received my order. Called in to check in on where my order was and they took a very long to respond back. He just said that the delivery guy left a long time ago and it should arrive any minute now. Didn't even offer a discount or anything. 

Save yourself some time and don't order from here.
author: Marcella C.

description: Horrible service , same guy takes order and cooks and delivers. Food quality poor , please don't waste money here , there are plenty of other better Indian restaurants to try around here.
author: Madhulika G.

description: Don't want to pile on here so I'm giving 3 stars.  One is a pity star. The men working were nice enough but this lunch was very bad. Empty place should have been a clue. Naan was the best part. I don't get to spend this much on lunch very often so it was a bummer.
author: Miss F.

description: Please save yourself some pain and don't oder from here. I ordered a meal for one at 6:30pm and the unpleasant woman on the phone said it would take one hour to get to me. I called almost two hours later at 8:15pm checking on my order. She said to give the driver another 20 minutes. I called back at 9:35pm over 3 hours from my order time. I told him I wanted to cancel the order. The guy that answered asked why, I told him it had been three hours, he told me to hold on and he'd check where the food was then he hung up on me. I made myself food and 20 minutes later the woman said her driver was lost and asked my address again. I told her I canceled the order and she said, "Sorry." Please do not order from here if you want to eat. I only had a small window in between work and sleep to eat and they ruined it. Thanks a lot.
author: Justin M.

description:
The last time I had delivery from here it was fabulous but tonight was a different story.

They sent me rice I didn't order. Pakora I didn't order. They didn't bring the Samosa I had ordered. The pappadums were crushed. The Butter chicken was burnt and inedible. The only semi-edible item was the daal but it wasn't hot and not fully cooked with some still slightly crunchy lentils in the mix.

I called to get the items I ordered redelivered and to complain about the burnt chicken but despite their promise to re deliver they never showed up. 

Very disappointed.
author: erin m.

description: I absolutely love this place. The food is some of the best Indian food i've ever had. The lunch buffet is awesome, and the owner is a really nice guy. Highly recommend, I do not at all understand how this place has 3 stars. That's the issue with Yelp, glad I didn't check Yelp before trying this place out :)
author: Zach S.

description: Flavorless box of heavy cream with chewy cardboard naan is what we got tonight when we ordered delivery of Malai Kofta and Garlic Naan. This might be our last order sadly and we actually used to order the same items regularly until a few months ago. Not sure if the mgmt changed in this time or the chef but the quality and flavors have clearly gone down. Not worth paying the $4.95 for naan so heavy and flavorless. And not worth getting bland Malai Kofta that does not taste fresh. Save your money because this Clay Oven no longer lives up to its once great reputation.
author: Shilpa J.

description: Warm Naam bread, yummy Mango Lassi, and all dishes are cooked to perfection with fresh sourced ingredients. This is one of my favorite spot for Indian cuisine in the city. You won't be disappointed. Enjoy!
author: François N.

description: We were really disappointed in our delivery tonight. The Raita was sour. The Muttar Paneer was so overcooked that there was no sauce and the cheese was hard and dry. The Chana Masala was also overcooked but not as dry. The Onion Bhaji was good but they forgot to include chutney and they sent regular naan instead of the garlic naan we ordered. I wouldn't recommend ordering delivery from them because you have to take what you get. I won't order from them again.
author: Jill P.

description: Horrible customer service. Can't tell you how the food is as I'm still waiting for my order 40 minutes later!!!
author: Monica B.

description: I ordered food, expected delivery: 1 hour. 1 1/2 hours later, I call, they say "5 minutes". 1 hour and 50 minutes, they say "one to two minutes". I tell them, don't bother, it's too late. After over two hours, they arrive, demand that I accept delivery. I refuse. They refuse to issue a refund. Wow.
author: George F.

description: Horrible customer service. Tikka masala was watered down and horrific. It seemed they just added water since I ordered 10 orders for my co-workers. Everyone gave it a thumbs down. All I can say is I'am very disappointed. Never again. Super over prized for poor quality food.
author: Gabi V.

description: Not sure if the lunch buffet was for American tastebuds,  cause it was not spicy at all. But their lamb dish was splendid, just not spicy.
author: C t.

description: I love Indian food and some of the dishes were delicious but my stomach turned the second I saw rodent feces near the window.  I hope they are addressing the issue so that there would be no health concerns to customers. The ambience and customer service was nice besides the rodent droppings.
author: Natie R.

description: I ordered delivery, it took almost 2 hours. The food had no flavor. I ordered very spicy tikka masala, and it was as spicy as mayo. The entree didn't come with rice, and they didn't even give utensils. I'm staying in a hotel, so it wouldn't make sense not to give them. I don't even know how these people are still open with such tasteless and bland food and slow service.
author: Britta F.

description: food took 2 hours to arrive, mediocre at best. i wasn't expecting much, but it fell below my expectations. oh well, lesson learned.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
It was bad. Bland garlic naan. Rubbery flat chicken tikka. Saag paneer had tofu not cheese. Rice was flavorless.

My mistake not following yelp. Used to know a delicious clay oven on Fillmore at Haight years ago.

Not the same. Not close.
author: Dan K.

description: the food is great. service is spotty. been here three times and and often find it hard to find good indian food in sf. this is the real deal. service was the worst the second time but went back anyway cause the food was so good. take out works if you don't want to take a chance.
author: Paul F.

description:
Delicious Indian food, my family and I always come here and throw family functions, they never let us down, great service, great food, great time.
Highly suggested!!!!
author: Shazanna T.

description: Food took 3 hrs to arrive. The food was stale and tasteless. I would give this place zero rating if possible. Overall, very disappointing and not recommended at all.
author: Suman F.

description: Yummy and affordable lunch buffet. Neighborhood restaurant. Love coming here or getting food to go. Feels like a quick  visit to India
author: Rotem N.

description: Husband got some last minute appetizers from them. Obviously zero expectations from last time experience. However, this time the food wasn't all that bad. Don't know if they changed the cook or not but the food didn't disappoint us that much. Will have to try the main courses though to see if the quality improved. Well I will try and give them another shot.
author: strfrm y.

description:
One of the worst Indian food I tasted my entire life . I ordered Chicken Biryani and you know what these guys will prepare Biryani . It's just stupid Jira rice and added some spices and also more than 5 star hotel price 

I didn't really tried buffet and I won't recommend this one if someone going to taste Biryani here .
author: Vivekananda D.

description: Best food in the area I have been coming here with my daughter for about 10 years waiters are very friendly make you feel at home and the food is always fresh.
author: Enrique N.

description: We ordered for delivery and the food arrived on time but that was the best part. Both the paneer and chicken tikka masala tasted like canned tomato paste and they did not bring the side items I requested. When I called to let them know that they did not bring me the side I ordered, the guy at the restaurant hung up on me. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Amit M.

description: Worst Indian food I have ever had in my entire life. Not only was the food tasteless and chewy, but they welcomed me with a bug on my plate. Looked like a baby cockroach. The waiter gave us 15% off and he could barely look at me to apologize. Never coming back.
author: Genesis A.

description:
This rating is actually for 3.5 stars.  The food was delicious and when we asked for non-spicy for the kids, the dishes actually arrived as requested without sacrificing flavor.  We ordered naan, rice, chicken saag paneer (hard to find!), raita, pappadum, and chicken tikka masala.  One of the kids couldn't stop mixing the raita with the other dishes to layer the flavors and kept asking for a second order of the raita (a first)!

Minus .5 star for service - distracted throughout dinner and took a while to get the bill, though we were the only table in house the entire time.  Overall, I'd return again!!
author: M G.

description: Just came by for lunch and was as delicious as I remember. Very fresh and just beautifully cooked buffet.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
The chef went to taste what his team had made...
Takes some curry in a spoon. Takes a taste. A moment's pause.
All hold their breath.
A frown. 
A blast.
'C'mon what's wrong with you? I can taste the food. Put some cream in there'.
Some cream later... 'A lil more.'
Takes another taste.
'Ahh nice.'
'Now go smother em boys!'

Note - this is a dramatized version of an imagined but likely true situation.

Nice-ish staff but...
the food was full of cream. Every single dish so that nothing had a flavour of its own; bland.

I went late at night, with my husband, happy that this option was open till 11pm. My first option, Spicy Bite where the food is on point was closed so I said - Let's try this other Indian place. 

We ordered a vegetarian Indian Thali for two. This was major for me as I was cheating in my diet and looking forward to the food. I was ready to dig in! The Thali had raita (yoghurt), palak paneer saag (spinach and cottage cheese), dal (lentils), baigan bharta (eggplant curry), rice, naan, kheer (milk pudding dessert). Quite a bit. The bill came to $40 including tip. But it was so not worth it :( Only the naan and rice was good. And yoghurt. And you have to try really hard to go wrong with these.

At the same time there was a now on, now off high pitch sound coming from the kitchen or somewhere and I kept wondering 'why am having to eat and pretend to enjoy a meal through this?' :S

So good ambience, nice-ish waiters but not good food.

It also feels bad that such fare should be offered to people exploring Indian food, who then perhaps think that this is what Indian food is like.

p.s - just read other reviews. Many people have been saying the same thing for a long time now. Why don't they fix it?
author: Malvika B.

description:
The food isn't amazing but they deserve a 4 star review because their all you can eat lunch buffet is such a good deal! Only $11 during weekdays I believe... 

The naaaaaan is boooomb
author: Aljosha N.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, but it was not a great experience overall...hopefully this was due to an off night.

I ordered goat cheese naan, chicken vindaloo & a side of rice for pickup.

First of all, and this is my bad for not checking before I left the restaurant...but they forgot to include my side of rice but didn't forget to charge me for it. For such a small order that took 30 minutes to complete, they shouldn't have forgotten.

Second, that goat cheese naan was more like jerky, I'm guessing the regular naan is better...so go with that.

Third, my chicken vindaloo sauce was awesome, but the chicken was incredibly overcooked...I mean I had to laugh because the food was so incredibly below average (except for the vindaloo sauce).

I hope they step up their game!
author: Lita T.

description:
My family and I throughly enjoyed our Christmas meal here. The lights were low, appropriate Indian music was playing in the background, the tables sparkled with white tablecloths and tiny lanterns. The waiter was both wonderfully professional and personable. And the food was amazing!
We'll be back.
author: Dixter D.

description: We came here on a Saturday for the lunch buffet and I was surprised that we were the only patrons. The food was fresh and hot and they had a great selection of dishes. The taste and quality weren't spectacular but they were very good. I'll definitely be back.
author: Diana G.

description: The food is great here is service is excellent. I don't know what is up with the low rating.
author: Cisco R.

description: I really liked this place. There is a nice ambience in the restaurant, our waiters was nice and friendly. We had 3 dishes which were all delicious. I will be going back here again. It's a really good local spot for Noe Valley. I'm surprised there aren't more customers there.
author: Neil L.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered delivery from Clay Oven and could not have been more disappointed with the experience. Our estimated delivery time was between 5:35 and 5:45pm. At 6:30pm we called to check in and were told that our food was on the way and should be there any minute. The food finally arrived at 7:15pm at which point we learned that the restaurant was more than an hour late in preparing the food. We called back to speak with a manager about the experience and were hung up on twice. Extremely disappointing experience. We will not be dining with Clay Oven again.
author: Megan B.

description:
It was an awesome experience which i couldn't forget  the taste of clay oven in my life and the way of approach was i can just say WOW........
I want everybody to try atleast once.....
author: Rajesh P.

description: Not crowded, music in the background, white table cloth, $10 brunch buffet style is very good. I am a happy camper.
author: Magda G.

description: I have been to lot of Indian restaurants..this one is special.. The best punjabi food is served here period. Very friendly staff and good ambience.
author: Rajessh P.

description:
This place is beautiful!   I walked in and thought wow this is probably expensive.   Today's lunch buffet was only $9.99!  After eating the food I realized why.   The food was set up in copper pots and looked beautiful.   But I'm very picky when it comes to Indian.   The Pakora was cold and a little greasy.  The rice was cold and a little hard.  The chicken tikka masala was delicious.   Tasted more like butter chicken which i actually prefer but it had a lot of bones.   It was fresh and really hot so it heated the rice. 

The restaurant itself would get  5 stars but the food was definitely a 3.  Good but nothing to really write home about.   Can't complain though for $9.99.  My husband is the easiest man to please so he'll tell you he loved this place and the food was delicious.  He ate 3 plates.  Again I'm a little more of a critic.   I'll probably be back.  But I will try a few more Indian places in SF first before I go back.
author: Rebecca M.

description: So good. Their buffet is a very reasonable $13. The chicken tikka masala had a ton of chicken and tasted great. They even have the buffet on the weekend (11-3) and it was empty (I have no clue why)
author: Mike Q.

description: This place has been our weekly takeout locale for the past few months. We had stopped coming here earlier in the year, due to mediocre portion sizes. That has all changed. Portion sizes are extensive, providing meals for a family of 3 over several nights. We go with our usual, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Korma, Saag Paneer (fantastic!), regular naan, and cheese naan. All of it is delicious. If you're looking for a some delicious indian cuisine, especially for takeout, this place fits the bill.
author: Steve R.

description:
I come here often and like it very much. Service is great and so is the food. A great place to grab lunch and hang out with coworkers or friends. The setup forces you to sit next to strangers which can lead to interesting conversations and meeting new people! Some of the servers are really good others are a little lousy but overall it's a great place to grub.

Because it's an interactive scenario with you cooking your own food you'll want to be ready to do so. They will walk you through the first few times and eventually you'll become a pro. Per our server's recommendation I ordered the naan and I really like it; it was hot and fluffy with just the right amount of crisp on the edges. Then I got a Chicken Tiki Masala and it was as good as the naan. You'll definitely be satisfied at the end but everything here is really light so you'll be ready for dinner later in the day.
author: Pocho G.

description:
My whole family loves this place. We eat in or order to go every week. We order chicken tikka masala, mild for the kids and chicken mushroom for me. 
Tip for  to go orders- ask for rice containers so you don't get your hot food in plastic containers. It is a bit messy but worth it to skip the plastic chemicals leaching into the food.
author: Anne B.

description: This place was delicious! The tikka Masala and naan was sooo good! We came here late at night and the food was exceptional. We ordered off the menu and not buffet. The complexity of the flavors did a happy dance around our tongue. When I think of Indian food I think of this place!
author: Laura R.

description:
Not authentic Indian food - not even close! We ordered from here for the first time and were extremely disappointed. My lamb jal-frazie tasted like a backwoods beef stew and the naan tasted like cardboard. 

We threw everything out after a few bites because it just wasn't worth it. You can't say you're an Indian restaurant and have food tasting like that - it insulting and wrong.

Two stars since the service was fast and polite, but 1 for the food. Will not be ordering here again.
author: Zachary S.

description: Everything was very hot. Very flavorful for "medium" spicy, just right.  Had samosas, m.soup, chicken biryani, riata, Kashmiri nan.    Very happily pleased since 3-4 months ago food not as good.  Hope food stays this good.  Waiter very nice and attentive.
author: Stan B.

description:
Ding, Ding, Ding... we've got a winner here. I can't vouch for everyone's experience, but my dinner was great! My friend Rosy and I were craving it and wanted to try out the Clay Oven in my neighborhood. Wasn't too sure about the prices before we stopped in but the decor is nice and the place was not too crowded. The place is pretty reasonable for the quality of food and service.

We ordered the Vegetable Samosas (2 per order and very big), the Chicken Tiki Masala (Very, Very, Very good), the Sag Paneer (a new one for Rosy and she loved it!!!), two orders of Rice (fluffy and good) and some regular naan fresh out of the oven.

The food was incredible, we left feeling very satisfied and loved this place.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I love Clay Oven! They have such a friendly staff and I can't get enough of their garlic Naan Bread with Chicken Tikka Masala.
author: Gabby B.

description:
I love India Clay Oven in West portal. I don't know how the restaurants are related but the only time I've been happy is when I get my order from West Portal.

Tonight husband "accidentally" picked the top google hit for India Clay Oven and ended up getting GruB Hub for ordering. They said the food came from India Clay on Church.

My Hyderabadi Chicken, though decent sized pieces, was tough and had  had ZERO Apricot's in it, not like what I'm used to. Yes it's not fair to blame one restaurant for not being as good as another but I do want to warn folk they are not INTERCHANGABLE. My husband's Lamb Jal-Frazie was good he thought, but we both agreed though having chosen mild, it was more like medium. Fine if  you want medium spice.

As our order didn't arrive until 1 hour and 30 mins after we ordered online via Grub hub. Indian food spiced medium-ish at 10:30...only if you are young or don't mind eating Tum's all night.

One thing better at this location, the N'aan is much nicer. More generous pieces and nicer texture, less grease. I wish I could have their bread at the other location but at the end of the day, the entree trumps all.
author: Susan F.

description: Delicious food but this place was deserted on a Friday night.  My only complaint is that you have to pay for every little thing: rice, naan, raita. I usually order a veggie thali when I go to indian restaurants but this place only offers it for two @ $43.  Let's face it: these ingredients are not costly, rice, lentils, flour.  I guess they're charging so much to pay the rent.
author: Pat P.

description: I really like this place.  The restaurant is really nice; great ambiance.  Owner/staff super nice.  Never had a bad experience.  I get a lot of take out.  It is really solid.  Nice neighborhood gem.
author: Zachary P.

description: Very nice people and great food and service! My husband and I go to St. Paul Church across the street, so we'll be frequenting this cute little Indian place more often!!!! The owner is a gem!!! So nice, great service, great prices and delicious food, chai tea and mayo lassi! The owner even gave us a free magi lassi just because!!! :)
author: Bridgette P.

description:
Great neighborhood Indian place. I usually order for takeout or delivery but have dined in, too, and the staff is always very kind. Clay Oven does a lot of to-go/delivery orders so getting a seat to dine in has never been a problem. They'll really do your food up spicy if you ask, so request it!
Solid neighborhood spot.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Not sure why people hate on Clay Oven. The food is amazing & these people are nice. Like, too nice. There's this lady that lives in my neighborhood that is straight crazy...or "eccentric" if you're being gentle. She looks wealthy, loves to eat out alone & on some days is very nice & chatty, on other days, she's walking around leaving monologue style messages on friends' (imaginary I suspect) voicemails with tons of curse words...and she's usually screaming. Anyway, one day she was at the Clay Oven losing her shit & they would.not.kick.her.out. It took them like 20 minutes to make her leave.

Anyway, order the tandoori chicken, the chicken saag, the okra dish, or the eggplant & you'll be happy as hell. Definitely get rice. The pappadum is better than the naan. The yogurt sauce is necessary if you get your food spicy. They also make an awesome hot sauce if you ask politely. Hell, you can yell at them, they'll still make it for you.

The lunchtime buffet is often quiet & has amazing food & a good price. I think it's $12.99 to fat it out & eat enough for a weekday food coma.

White table clothes, adorable serving bowls (copper), very clean bathroom, beautiful painting on the wall & lovely service. Seriously, like "I can't date you b/c you're too nice" nice.

TIP: I've only ordered from them once or twice & it was delivered fine & on time, but they seem to have issues with that, so walk or drive to pick it up.
author: Stephanie F.

description: The best second date place around. Tikka was fire af. naan naan naan was as buttery as Paula Deen.
author: Christine S.

description:
My husband and I live a couple of blocks away from Clay Oven so we have walked over for dinner a couple of times.  The food is quite tasty and we can always get seated.

I think they may have a lunch buffet; they have a beautiful array of copper chafing dishes along the back wall.  The walls, in fact, are painted with a beautiful indian mural.
author: Rachel S.

description: We live nearby and love coming here every few weeks. We're often one of the only tables there so the food comes quickly and the service is great. We always ask them to make Paneer Tikka Masala (which isn't listed on the menu) and it's always delicious.
author: Max E.

description:
The story of how I ended up eating here makes my experience more sad. If you don't want to read this rantish paragraph.. skip to the next one! So I was supposed to go to Kome Sushi Buffet with my friends but the line was ridiculously long. I was so looking forward to eating lots of sushi!! After awhile we gave up and tried to go to Regent Thai and found out it was closed since it was Christmas week ): EVEN MORE DISAPPOINTMENT. So lastly... my friend suggested Clay Oven. I like Indian food and all but after looking forward to all you can eat sushi, I was still pretty sad ): Anyways...

We came here for the lunch buffet. There were only two other tables of people when we got there. The selection included lamb, tandoori chicken, naan, curry, some kinda rice, fried fish or calamari (I forgot what it was!) and some vegetarian dishes. Everything was just okay. The food was pretty lukewarm... I guess that's expected since it's a buffet... but still it made the food worse than it probably was. My favorites were the fried fish/calamari/whatever it was and the naan. I feel like those shouldn't be favorites at an Indian restaurant. Well except the naan I guess. It's just that everything was bland and just average. I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Sandra N.

description: Lots of good flavors here on previous visits but super bummed to find huge super long hair in our naan. Waiter didnt say anything as i pulled the very long strand out and threw it on floor. He just walked away. I tried to let it go and continue on with meal. Then when smaller eyelash or beard  sized hairs fell off naan I stopped. Spit out food into napkin. Realized that there was a strong possibility there hair in our other dishes. Grossed out. Got the bill...even had to pay for the hair naan. Won't be back.
author: h h.

description:
I live right down the block from Clay Oven and have always wanted to try it. But I was a bit wary considering every time I walked by, there were very few people actually dining there. First things first, it seems like the majority of people who eat here either order take-out or delivery. So don't be dissuaded on that front. I chose the take-out option. Bonus: Only took 10 minutes for my order to be ready.

After reading mediocre reviews that kept me away, it looked like they were on the up and up so I decided to give it a try. My order: naan, vegetable samosa, chana masala, and rice. 

My barometer for a good Indian restaurant is the quality of their naan. Hot and fluffy with just the right amount of crisp on the edges. I'm sad to say that their naan was lukewarm and kind of floppy. If I had to guess, they need to let the dough rise more and keep their tandoor at a lower temperature so that the bread has more time to bake without burning. Veggie samosa: just okay. Also on the lukewarm side and the pastry shell was kind of greasy rather than flaky. Chana masala: I ordered it medium-spicy and I like hot things. This was maybe a shade too hot. Overall, halfway decent and the curry was just the right consistency. Rice: Pretty much your standard basmati rice. Light and fluffy...and they gave me some fresh green peas as a bonus!

End result: The food is merely okay. I didn't feel the need to spit it out, but I also didn't feel compelled to save the leftovers either. The person who took my order on the phone was very nice and the woman who cashed me out was sweet, which counts for something. If you can find better Indian food in Noe, let me know.
author: Meredith D.

description: Yummm...y! The most delicious Indian food I've had in a long time! Simply amazing food, superb hospitality and a nice cozy ambience at a really low cost. True they say - Big things come in small packages.
author: Sanchita R.

description: Serious fail. I put anorder in Eat24 and submitted an order for delivery. The debit was taken and got confirmation. 40 min after the delivery time, I called the restaurant and was told they don't deliver to my address. Why was the order confirmed? Oh, failed to mention that I received notice that the order was on the way.
author: Dave C.

description: Vegetable pakora was delicious- delivery arrived hot and came with two dipping sauces, one sweet red sauce and a green chutney. Prawn biriyani was pretty good-- the raisins and nuts were plentiful, though the rice was a little dry. Biriyani usually comes with a yogurt sauce, but this one didn't. I loved the paneer makhni, it was my favorite dish. We would up pouring it over the biriyani to soften it up, which was just perfect. Delivery was fast, 30-40 minutes. I'll definitely order again.
author: Kaya C.

description:
Delicious Indian food at reasonable prices. The chicken tandoori, masala and vindaloo are particularly good. So is the rice and nan. Everything served hot.

Great ambience, neighborhood and very friendly service.
author: Rob M.

description:
The service was excellent. The manager and the server/busser were absolutely cordial and welcoming. We went for dinner on a Wednesday night and had the entire restaurant to ourselves. They made us feel like we were guests in a friends house.

Food is delicious, if served in very small portions.
author: Arturo G.

description: If it was possible I would give this place zero stars. Worst Indian food I have ever had. Made both my husband and myself ill after only a couple of tasteless, salty bites.
author: Angel C.

description:
Overall, I'm a fan or Clay Oven.  We lived a block down the street, and always enjoyed take out from here.  The food was always consistently delicious.

The staff get top marks for friendly, courteous, and good quality service.  The kitchen is within view of the dining room, which is nice.  My wife and I always remarked how impeccably clean the staff kept the restaurant.  Someone always seemed to be scrubbing the restaurant any given morning.

It's a bit on the pricey side, at least for take out.  The decor and ambience and a cut above the rest in upper Noe Valley, so maybe it's deserved for dining in.
author: Steve J.

description: We've lived in Noe Valley for three years and we're JUST discovering this place.... What have we been doing all this time?! The food is superb- flavorful, high quality meat, and authentic. The staff is friendly and professional. The ambiance is really nice as well. If you live in the area, this has to be your go to Indian restaurant.
author: Kelly G.

description: Usually, I'm not a big fan of Indian buffet, but, I must admit, the chicken tikka masala is some of the best I've had.  Not a bad place to go for a guy on a strict lunch budget with a big appetite.
author: Eric G.

description:
This is my first review here on yelp and I post it just because I liked the meal at this place so much.

I live in the area and so came for the lunch buffet. Had the Chicken Masala, rice and vegetables. The Chicken Masala was one of the best I had in the city. The complementary bread arrived hot and was delicious. And like others wrote, the service is great and the place is inviting.

I would recommend trying it out to anyone in the area.
author: Moshe B.

description:
I have been ordering delivery from this place for a couple of years, and up until 3 months ago was happy with it. But their delivery service has now become a joke. They used to have great drivers, and food would be delivered within 30 to 40 minutes, now between 60 and 90 minutes, and the guy on the phone is a joke. 

If getting a delivery make sure you don't want to get it for an hour and a half and that you want it delivered cold. If you do you will love this place,
author: Dave O.

description:
This review is long overdue. I discovered this location as an alternative to Toast (which is down the street). The wait for Toast was almost an hour so my group decided to see what was down the street and we discovered Clay Oven.

This review is only for their Lunch Buffet.

I really enjoy the food that is offered for the lunch buffet. I like how they have a few vegetarian dishes along with the meat dishes. My favorite dishes are the Vegetable Coconut Curry, Lamb Curry, and Chicken Masala. For the price I pay, I always leave full and satisfied.

My only tip is to make sure you get their before 1PM at the latest. After 1PM, the freshness of the buffet food begins to waiver if they have not had a lot of visitors. I can't really complain because it only makes sense.
author: Jesson d.

description:
Love the Food. 
Love the friendly service. 
Do not love being overcharged each time I get my bill. 

Whether we dine in or take out, we consistently find we are charged for items we didn't order, or there is a higher charge than what the menu indicates. The last time I pointed this out to Babu he said there had been a price increase. But it's not reflected on either the take-out or dine-in menu. 

Another time, they gave me (and charged me) for 2 orders of rice, when I only ordered one. When I pointed this out, Babu said he wouldn't charge me for it. Yet there it remained on my bill, and I had to insist he delete the charge. 

I can't imagine the number of times my bill was padded before I started noticing.

It's a real buzz-kill, when you are trying to support a local establishment, and they purposely taking advantage. 

We used to get their take-out every week or two. But after the most recent episode, we are boycotting them. 

I don't know how the other Clay Oven locations operate, but just keep a close watch on your bill.
author: Bonnie B.

description: I've ordered takeout from here at least 10-15 times over the past few years. The chicken korma is delicious and consistent. Same with the goat cheese naan. I've only eaten in their dining room once or twice. The staff is nice but almost overly attentive, especially because the place is usually pretty empty.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
2 1/2 stars

I had ordered from this place a while back, and couldn't really remember what I had thought of it. Since I was sick of Zante's delivery screwing me over, I decided to give Clay Oven a try again.

On the plus side, they have online ordering which was quick and easy . The delivery was quick and friendly (unlike Zante's). And the food was package properly so it didn't explode all over the bag (a la Zante's).

On the down side, I had no idea Indian food could be so bland! I ordered two veggie dishes and was not crazy about either one of them. And the Nan was sorta dry. 

I might try again, because it seems like a friendly, well-run business--maybe I just need to find the right dishes.
author: Wendy G.

description:
I only order Chicken Tikka Massala with regular nan, yes I know I'm too predictive, but it is delicious!! 
From Clay Oven I usually order delivery, and its too expensive for the amount , and they are not very good to deliver on time over at Bayview where I live, they take forever, but in the end it is always delicious and just how I ordered.
When I mean the size is too small, its a round container filled till the top with chicken and juice, mostly juice but good amount of hardened cooked chicken complementing the flavors... Size is 3 inches tall, by 4.5 in diameter, all for $12.95
author: Christina L.

description: Wanted to give the place another shot after a terrible dinner. This time we tried takeout. Naan tasted like it was reheated. Even rice pilaf, something so basic for an Indian place, felt like it was a few days old. THere's a reason the place is empty all the time
author: Aravind R.

description: I came back here for some take out and was so disappointed! The samosas weren't flavorful whatsoever. Not sure what happened but I think I will need to switch to a different indian restaurant :(
author: Claudia L.

description:
No Love Here!

Indian is our fav & we were totally stoked to see a walking distance spot open up.  Got take-out last night & couldn't wait to get it home & dig in.....but after 1 taste, it was apparent we'll have to keep on waiting for that Fab-Indian spot to open up.

Food was completely MEH....Mali Kofta sauce looked & tasted like Chef Boyardee tomato soup...COMPLETELY SPICELESS;  Spinach - same; Garlic Naan was tasteless as well & stingy on the portion

Final straw....the Kheer was rancid (YES...rancid!) & we threw it out for fear of food poisoning

Would like to think this was a 1-time snafu as they get settled in & might be willing to give 1 more try before completely dismissing but then again, this is a semi-chain (w/ 4 other SF locations) so the recipes should be the same no matter where you go....right?

Hmmmmmmm.........
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Love their $10 lunch buffet. The selection rotates a bit, but you generally have a choice of grilled chicken, marinated lamb, chicken curry, salad, basmati rice, and variety of vegetable-based dishes, sides of various chutneys and naan. For dessert they offer coconut ice cream, honey cake balls (not sure of the name), and chai tea.

I also love the music they play. Last time I was there, they were bumping a Bollywood song featuring Snoop Dogg! 

Street parking can be tough here, but I like that t's nestled in a residential area. The meal is inexpensive, but the ambiance (cloth napkins, silverware, etc.) makes it a little more formal. Clay Oven is a great place to introduce friends and family to Indian food because their buffet makes it easy to try new dishes. It's cookie cutter, but the food is good and it's a great value.
author: Mariela D.

description: I had better Indian food in Eastern Europe 15 years ago. Nothing about my dining experience was terrible, but I can't think of a reason I'd ever come back here.
author: Eric L.

description:
In three words:  Disappointing, doughy, and inexcusable

--------

Service:  I placed an order via Eat24 at 8:36pm and the driver did not reach my door until 10:28pm.  (Estimated wait time was 45-60 minutes.)  Needless to say, super disappointed.  After telling the driver it's been two hours, the driver assured me it won't happen next time, and I confirmed that it wouldn't... because I will never order from them again.

Food:  Ordered nan, rice, lamb jal-frazie, vegetable korma, and chicken tikka masala.  The only good dish was the chicken tikka masala.  The lamb was not tender and actually quite chewy, and difficult to cut into even with a dinner knife.  Nothing special about the vegetable korma, but it wasn't bad.  What surprised us the most particularly was the nan, you would assume that it would be fully cooked...not the case.  The bread was still doughy on the edges.  I had to stick it in the oven for a few minutes to actually enjoy it.

Takeaway?  
- Eat24 did their best to follow up with the restaurant--I totally acknowledge that it's the restaurant that's to blame. I checked on my order using the chat feature in the app three times, the first time being at 75 minutes... 15min out of the estimated 45-60 minute window.   I tried to cancel my order about 90 minutes into it, but to no avail.  I went all through Eat24, and my only direct interaction with the restaurant was with the driver.  
- If possible, DON'T add tip (as a prepaid function on Eat24--tipping before service) to your credit card order, because this service was NOT deserving.  I happily add gratuity when the service is good, but this was unacceptable.
- Apologies are appreciated, but had I looked closer at the reviews of the restaurant, I would not have ordered from this establishment.  Clay Oven is located 1.6 miles away from my apartment, approximately 6 minutes by car according to Google maps.  

Really, there's no excuse, especially considering they've been a repeat offender on delivery and service with other customers.  Not an efficient business plan, especially when I'm spending over 50 bucks on take-out for two.
author: Justin P.

description:
Solid food! I wish there was a way to rate food, service and delivery time separately because this place deserves way higher than three stars for their delicious food. 

We love our Indian food and this killed expectation. 

Chicken Tikka Masala- YUM! Highly recommend 
Chicken Vindaloo- hubby thought it was delicious
Naan- Best part of the dinner, a great combo of crunchy ends and fluffy inside 
Potato and pees- good, but will skip next time
Samosa - def skip
Papadum(so?)- love 
Tamarind Sauce- one of the best I've had

Service- 5 stars, super attentive and sweet. 

We really loved it here and will def me back!!
author: Candace D.

description: I have been to this restaurant a few times before (due to the proximity to my home). However, every time I've had delivery they have been delayed. Today takes the cake! I ordered food at 6:40pm to have it delivered by "promised" 7:14pm on a Wednesday night but did not receive my order until 8:40pm. When I called to complain that my dinner guests were sitting hungry and upset, some man named Sunil refused to let me speak to a manager and offered to give me a discount without any details of how said discount would be attained. When I started to get upset, he patronized me and made me feel upset. I was extremely embarrassed that I had dinner guests over when I had raved about this Indian restaurant that didn't even get to taste the food (they had to leave prior to the TWO HOUR delivery delay). I will NOT be going back, and will ONLY be giving my business to Roti Indian Bistro, which is 2 miles away but gets my food to me within 30 minutes...not promised, ACTUALLY.
author: Teji K.

description: I was in town for the week, and found this delightful restaurant within walking distance of where I was staying. The server was charming, and welcomed me warmly. The lamb korma was tender and rich, and the goat cheese naan (the first I've ever had), was fresh and flavorful. I would go back again if I'm ever in town again!
author: Liz S.

description:
Cheap lunch buffet.
Decent selection.
Pleasant staff.
Clean.
author: Inigo M.

description: The food is ok. Service also ok. But dont have much options.
author: Kunal P.

description: Been eating here for 3 years. Great food and great service. The chai is delicious! The food at the restaurant is way better than the take out just because the nan and pakora get steamed by the packaging.
author: Abby S.

description: My neighborhood Indian go-to! Very good and sweet service. They have an amazing buffet lunch special for $10, incredible value. The take out is good and easy and the food is pretty tasty. Very convenient. I like it.
author: Sushi K.

description:
This has been the best Indian food we've found yet in San Francisco!  Only one small complaint, but we'll get to that later.

They brought us Papadams to start.  They were light, crispy, and delicious!  For appetizers we selected the Vegetable Samosas and Onion Bhaji.  Both were excellent.

We had two entries - the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Lamb Seekh Kabab.  I ordered the Tikka Masala with medium heat and thought it was a little on the mild side.  Not a problem since both were, you guessed it, delicious.  We ordered two servings of rice which were served in cute little silver buckets.    And two orders of Onion Kulcha - which was yummy.

Our only complaint was that the Seekh Kabab was brought to our table about five to ten minutes before the naan, rice, and Tikka Masala.  It's not really something you can eat by itself, so we just stared at it until the rest of our meal arrived.

It's easy to get to the restaurant as it's right on the J-Church Metro line.  For those driving street parking shouldn't be much of a problem in this area.
author: Ed J.

description:
I'm surprised this place doesn't have better reviews, I've consistently liked it. As an Indian-American I feel I have the right to praise or criticize Indian restaurants so here goes :)

This place has tasty food and good service. We actually just went with another (non-Indian) couple and all 4 of us really liked it. The food was fresh and tasted authentic, and without the grease that fills other restaurants' food. On top of that, it was a really good value and I appreciated the constant refills of water. 

This is our neighborhood Indian restaurant and we'll definitely return. I can smell the garlic naan now...
author: S S.

description:
If you don't have any taste buds, don't mind dry meat and have money to burn, this place could be fine! But if you want tasty food at a fair price, there are plenty of better alternatives.

I wasn't pleased with ANY of the dishes. And for nearly $100 for 3 of us (no drinks), I think we could have done a lot better. Not the worst food in the world. But I've had much better for much less money.
author: Jon K.

description: I really want to give them more stars. The food is amazing, but the delivery times are too unreasonable. 2+ hours, about 90 minutes on average. I will pick it up myself next time. If you do have the patience, try the chicken saag. It makes it worth the wait.
author: Andy T.

description:
Table service was poor. The waiter, while polite, was simply not up to the job. He was inattentive to our needs, slow to respond and did not know the menu; dessert and drinks were particularly badly handled. Note that we were the only party in the restaurant and there were two small kids who were clearly getting antsy. We are fairly easy to please and normally not inclined to be critical of wait staff. Their main business at dinner, and their priority, seems to be take out. 

Main courses were OK (tandoori chicken, chicken tikka masala, hyderabadi lamb and palak-daal) but the naan was not the best which is bit of a deal killer in an Indian place. 

The dining experience overall did not inspire confidence.
author: Anu G.

description:
$10 lunch buffet, great music, and friendly service makes this one of my favorite indian restaurants.

I came here with some girls I babysit and the waiters seemed overjoyed as usual to see the family and greeted them by name.  They brought out fresh naan for us and didn't charge us for the mango lassi.  The food is incredible although not as spicy as I usually like but the cheerful friendly service and experience more than makes up for that!
author: Stephanie G.

description: I really REALLY like this place as far as food goes but their delivery is THE WORST if you're expecting the food in the time frame they say, which this evening was forty to forty-five minutes, I have been waiting an hour and twenty-five minutes right now. You might be thinking that this is JUST a rare occurrence but I have given them quite a few chances and tonight is the last unfortunately. I called an hour and fifteen minutes into this current delivery nightmare and was told another fifteen minutes thirty minutes ago. So, if you want to go and dine-in here, this is your place. If you want delivery, I would pass. It's unfortunate because I really want to see them be successful. I'd give them four stars for the food but no stars for delivery. They get two stars tonight because I feel extremely guilty having to write this review as I'm an easy person to please. If you read this Clay Oven, you might want to rethink your delivery problems and see what you can do to not lose devoted customers like me.
author: Padric M.

description: I ordered from this location by accident today instead of the one on Clement street and it was a huge mistake. The lamb in the lamb tikka masala was burnt and dry, the naan barely had any filling at all, the sauce in the chicken curry was extremely bland, and the chicken was very dry. The only decent things were the samosas and the sauce for the tikka masala. I'm really disappointed since the other locations I've ordered from have always been delicious.
author: Melissa C.

description:
My work has occasionally bought take out here for meetings, etc and I've always really loved this food. I'm basically addicted to Indian food, and what that means is that I've eaten a lot of it.
 
I had a night to myself recently and I wanted Indian food, but someplace new. Even better would be someplace that I already know is good, so here I went.

I walked in and was not expecting what I saw at all. It's a nice place. Much nicer than I'm used to. Tables clothes and a variety of silverware was on the table. I'm pretty much a fan of the dives that serve food that's so good that everybody can get over how nasty dirty the bathrooms are and that you have to get your own silverware and napkins. Needless to say, the bathrooms were just fine.

I ordered spicy food and it was fairly spicy. It certainly had a good kick, but it didn't pop my ears or anything. I ordered samosas and they had this spicy chutney that was the bomb. Awesome.

I had a really nice experience here and spent more than the dives that I'm used to. But I had a nice glass of wine and great service. It was a good night.
author: Erica F.

description: As an update to my review earlier this year, we ordered take-out recently and everything was top-par. The curries are no longer watered down, they are delicious and spicy, and the samosas are a new favorite. I'm happy to see them turn around, kick ass and make some delicious Indian food!
author: Jamaica D.

description:
The food was good, the cockroach I shared a table with was not. Nor did they discount our bill. They also brought us an unrequested double order of nan and charged us for it. Maybe they realized we would not be back. 

Too bad too, because the chicken that came out of the, I think he said 1000 degree, oven was really tasty. I also felt secure that any insects would not have survived on that steaming hot dish. 

What did survive was a baby cockroach on the wall that was watching me from the new table our waiter assigned us to. Yick.
author: Elise B.

description:
OMG so sad!  I moved into the neighborhood a month ago and tried this place out. Since it's one of the few restaurants in the little 30th and Church area, I wanted to LOVE. It's not a good sign when a Friday night around 7:30 pm, it was empty. Literally we four were the only diners for the first hour, and when we left there were maybe two other pairs of two. That, while kind of weird and sad, was fine because everything was delicious, the prices were reasonable and the service was great. They even gave us complimentary chai tea that was sooo delicious at the end of the meal.  So what's the kicker?  

The bill came, we paid, and were at that point so overfull we could barely roll out of there. Then, a cockroach crawls across the wall right over my friend's head. And we were sitting at the table right next to the kitchen. 

We all felt instantly sick and there was not a fight over the leftovers.  I hesitated putting this review up because they seem like they want to make it work, and I want an Indian restaurant in my neighborhood, but guys, clean it up, please!!
author: Kari J.

description:
I had an enjoyable experience the first time I went to the Clay Oven. The second time, however, was a bit creepy...as in creepy crawly.  Having lived in Asia for many years, I'm generally not put out by a little extra protein in my food, but in the fine culinary capital of San Francisco, it's utterly unacceptable.

I went to CO on a bright sunny day and started to make my way down the lunch buffet.  Salad, check. Rice, check.  Fried thingy, pass. Lentil curry, hmmm, Veggie curry hmmm. All of the sudden, as I was contemplating my favorite veggie options, I saw something move on the wall.  Was my contact sliding out of place? No. It was a roach. Not an East Coast waterbug size or Asian flying roach but, rather a nice lean, Prius sized roach.  I didn't move, it kept minding it's own business. I did some quick math on the likelihood of my new friend finding it's way into my lunch and decided the possibility was remote and soldiered on.  

I was going to mind my own business until I sat down at my seat and started eating my lunch, which was not bad, though parts of it were cold. Again in my peripheral vision, I spied the Prius' little brother--smart car sized--climbing up the wall.  Here I am YELPING!!!

Stay away until the hygiene police or the exterminator complete their next pass.
author: ai f.

description: In a word: Awful. Waited forever for my order to be taken. Waited forever for my food. It was not worth the wait. I know Indian naan can be a bit greasy but the chapati had pools of oil on each piece. The Coconut Lamb I ordered came in a tasteless orange sauce. The meat was poor quality - chewy and not fresh. Small portion too. To top it all off they charged me 3 bucks for the rice. Never again.
author: Chuck S.

description: Got delivery; the nan was soggy and inedible. Otherwise it was just sort of ok, not great. Won't return.
author: Travis N.

description:
This failed on all levels for me. Placed the delivery order and noticed dang, pricey. Like $14 a plate pricey. Nevertheless I imagined that my spinach was hand massaged, free range, organic and possibly grown on the moon. How else could potatoes and spinach cost so much? I started to salivate.

And salivate, and salivate, and salivate. Basically at this point I am laying in a pool of my own drool on the couch, dehydrated, and so hungry because it has been TWO HOURS since the delivery order was placed! TWO HOURS! on a MONDAY! I felt like one of my cats peeking out the window at the sound of every car door shutting but alas it was just the neighbors every time.

Finally, my dude says "let's just make something" and at that exact second the food arrived. Victory! Hooray for expensive tasty food. Oh wait, this isn't tasty at all! Nan was cold and rubbery. Masala was covered in grease. I blotted 2 paper towels to pick it up - not creamy at all. Tastes just like the curry paste you buy at the market. And the spinach. Gooey, goopey with undercooked potatoes.

Never again.
author: Allegra F.

description:
First thing when you walk in - the smells! So good!

The Spinach Pakora - out of sight, delicate, chewy, crunchy. Samosas - spicy filling, just right. Vindaloo Fish = Salmon - mild flame-y goodness, also great for our pal who had a cold. Chai - I'm a tough critic - very good and served with honey (a plus) - spiced *just so*. Saag Paneer and Muttar Paneer - both dishes were flavored delicately and uniquely. I can imagine from our spread, that the meat and other seafood dishes would be equally well prepared!

Would have been 5 stars if they had soy chai. E-mailed them. We'll see what happens. Making CO a neighborhood favorite.
author: Mark S. I.

description:
I thought the lunch buffet was a good deal for $10.  They had many different dishes to try and I enjoyed the food.  My favorite was the tandori chicken and the rice.  Yes, the nan was tasty too.  
The lunch crowd was sparse today but that was a good thing for us.  Besides two other customers, we were the only ones there.  I'm not a big fan of Indian food but I would come again to eat.
author: Brent T.

description: Experienced delivery tonight. It was pretty pricey - $18 for 1 dish and rice to be delivered. They had a very hard time with the name of my street, but we eventually got passed that. I ordered Chicken Makhani. I don't know how it's different from Chicken Tikka Masala, but I don't care. It was pretty good. The sauce reminded me of the texture of Elmer's glue in the best way possible. I didn't like how they cut the chicken - lots of ligaments. But, I would order from here again, especially if someone else were paying.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I went here for the Indian Buffet. I would like to mention, I LOVE Indian Buffet. There aren't too many places in the city that even do it. But I digress. This was tasty. really hit the spot. I wasn't the one who picked up the tab, but I thought it was a decent price for all that we had. 
On another note. The dinner menu is a tad too pricey for my liking. That's a whole other review though. But I would recommend the lunch buffet if anyone is looking.
author: Jena D.

description:
Their lunch buffet is great. It's probably the best Indian buffet I've had around SF - and I've tried a lot.

There were a few months when things went a little awry with their selection, but we were just there & everything's back on track. The food is delicious, the place is meticulously clean, and the staff friendly.

It's my go-to in the neighborhood. I've gone for dinner, too, which is quite a bit busier, and also quite nice.
author: judah m.

description:
This is, thus far, the best sit-down Indian Restaurant in SF. It's quiet. You can always find a seat. And the malai kafta is pretty tasty. (East Bay has more/better Indian restaurant options.) 

Downsides: Parking can be a pain. It's a little expensive (tho' not unusual for SF). And decor is a bit dry.
author: O. K.

description: Indian food should never be bland.  Despite very courteous service, all three dishes we ordered were not good.
author: Ari O.

description: I'm always surprised that more people in the neighborhood don't support this restaurant. It's clean and has a nice atmosphere, great and attentive service. Love the food. It's one of our local go-to's.
author: Michelle S.

description: Delicious curries and tandoori; friendly service; clean and bright decor.  Great neighborhood feel with authentic food.  A fan!
author: Carlo A.

description:
Have eaten here many times and the garlic naan is to die for! 

This is a nice place to go to for a date or nice dinner during the week. 

The service is always impeccable!
author: Shannon B.

description:
I just checked my delivery.com account and I have ordered from here 26 times.  Last night will be the last time I order from them.

I look for two things in a place I frequent regularly, quality and consistency.  Over the past few months the quality and consistency have gone down considerably.  I order almost the same thing every time and lately those dishes don't resemble what I used to order or even what the order looked like the previous time. 

My favorite dish is Malia Kofta.  It used to be really creamy and had a rich tomato flavor.  About 2 months ago it got really watery and started to have black flecks in it.  Last night it was yellow and thick.  Additionally there used to be cashews and or almonds in the sauce and cooked into the Kofta balls.  Lately they just started to put them in the sauce.  Now there is nothing.

I used to count on this place as a sure thing.  Now even the delivery is spotty and late.  I've had wrong food delivered and had to wait two hours before... I only live 7 blocks away.  I could have walked there and had dinner.

I went to Spicy Bite the other night and got their Malia Kofta.  It reminded me why I fell in love with that dish.  There was so much care in the dish; you could tell that they used so many more ingredients in the dishes preparation.  Spicy Bite does cost more but it is worth it.

I wish Clay Oven could get their act back together, they really used to be so good.
author: Jeremy P.

description: Very good food here. Ordered mild and got it spicier than I expected, but really just right. The coconut curry chicken is to die for.
author: Len M.

description:
Hmm I`m a little taken back by the reviews here. I happen to always LOVE the food from here and we get it often.  Then again I have never actually been inside , my honey usually stops here after work to pick up dinner. 
  My only grip from this company is the "SOMA" location leaves large pieces of spice in the food which I hate. It`s not pleasant to byte into it.  Other than that I love it.
author: Jack O.

description:
Just came back from lunch - went with three others and we all had the lunch buffet ($9.95).   I was pleased, as was the other carnivore of the group, but my vegetarian (and picky!) sister and her partner were not impressed. 

On the lunch buffet - a very pathetic looking salad, rice, deep fried fish nugget things, spinach with cheese (sag paneer, I think), lamb curry, tandoori chicken, another chicken dish, eggplant and and veggies, rice pudding and some other dessert.  

I thought that everything was fine (minus the salad) and the spinach was ESPECIALLY good.   We had a friendly server who always kept our water glasses filled and even brought out a special drink for my baby nephew.   Oh, and they bring out oven fresh naan to go with your food.  YUM. 

Only two things I wish were different - no lentil dishes were out on the buffet (I loooooove lentils) and also none of the dishes were very spicy.

All in all, I had a good experience, and would definitely go back for the lunch buffet again!
author: Amy M.

description:
This is a pretty high-end indian place on church street with cloth napkins and a low lighting and stuff like that. The environment is quite pleasant, the service is somewhat formal, the food seems to be of a high quality for the most part...and the prices reflect all of that. I could go to Zante's and spend a lot of less, but i'd be risking a stomach ache. After eating here, you don't feel like death! 

The fish tikka masala ($14.95) is especially noteworthy-get this if you like salmon! It's actually surprisingly hard to find fish tikka masala on the menu of most indian restaurants, and that will be what I come here for primarily. The mango lassis and garlc naan are also good. I would say the sag paneer was only okay-needed some salt. The presentation of the food is nice...i like how the rice comes in little metal buckets.

I've also never seen it too crowded...a good bet if you want dinner NOW and can't be bothered to wait.
author: Shannon R.

description: Delivery for this place sucks. Waited 1hr40mins before the delivery guy was even near my house. I called the resto after an hour and they said it would be another 2 minutes and hung up when I told him I didnt want the food anymore. After waiting another 30 minutes they call back saying they will offer a discount, I turned them down and hung up. Once the delivery guy was at my door I apologized and told him I did not want the cold food. Will definitely not order delivery from this place again. Maybe one day I will give this resto a visit instead.
author: Judy Z.

description:
I reluctantly ordered rom them because they are just down the block from me and I'd like to really know the landscape of what's good and what's not.  People tend to be very hit and miss on Indian places - a place that I love a friend might hate and vice versa, so I figured with 3 stars on Yelp I should give it a shot.

The first thing that threw me was reading the recent reviews on here - A review from the user named "Sirish", which is no longer present after being reported to Yelp, contained the same exact paragraph about Saag being a healthier alternative, including the same weird broken English in the later paragraphs as the review from Nik C's below (who happens to only have one review... hmm...).  Clearly a bogus review, but I figured maybe the business had made some changes and wanted to bump up their Yelp rating.

Fast forward to a couple of nights ago, and as I mentioned I decide to order from them.  I got the following:

Chicken Pakoras:  Basic, unseasoned chicken fried in an unflavorful batter.  The tamarind sauce is the only thing that even remotely saved them

Lamb Saag:  I love lamb.  I love saag.  I usually get some combination of the two or the two together every time I eat Indian food.  The lamb was OK, but the saag was a disgusting pureed sauce, not even reminiscent of spinach.  It's like they put the entire dish into a blender

Kheer:  Respectable

Ultimately, I would've liked to enjoy their food much more than I did, but I was completely unimpressed.  The food was incredibly mediocre.  The delivery service was reasonably quick.  Ultimately, I'm rating them 1 star because of the incredibly mediocre food and the fake shill reviews.
author: David T.

description: I love the kashmiri naan at this place an the service is always great. Takeout is amazing too!
author: Michelle L.

description: Delivery took an hour and 40 minutes. Their excuse..... "you were so far away".  If we were so darn far, they should not have agreed to deliver. Food was cold, we had to microwave everything. Bad service and mediocre food. Not ordering from them again.
author: Stephanie B.

description: One and a half hour later and no food, we called and they said oh he's already here a blatant lie,  so  I came here to see if other people had this problem as well, seems like no one should be ordering from this place, thanks for nothing, and I don't care if you already made the food and its on its way, tell your driver he can enjoy it, and thanks for hanging up on us, when we tried to cancel. Hmm and it seems just as I'm writing this review he has called, it is now 1 hour and 40 minutes since we placed the order, he offered to give me a discount, I told him I didn't want it and said bye, he called back again and offered it at half off, "no thanks, I already ate, I don't want your cold Indian food, you can eat it yourself" He let out a sigh, it seems like he is finally done calling, Enjoy your meal, and have a safe drive home guy.
author: Bruce W.

description:
I generally like this place - in fact - their lunch buffet is quite good w/many selections. 
Tonight, however, my BF and I had an early dinner and the chef had to start cooking again. Halfway through our rice with potatoes dish [no potatoes !] a big, black, dead fly was found. Yuch! 
They did not comp us the rice dish. [bad marketing!]............instead gave us 2 complimentary rice desserts. I could have done without the extra calories for sure, but I love this stuff. 
I'll go back - but will check the food carefully first.
author: Carol S.

description:
Sometimes it takes anger to bring a dude back from Yelp sabbatical.

We ordered at 5:38pm. After three calls to Clay Oven HQ, the driver started calling to tell me he was in Noe Valley. I live in Bernal Heights.

At 8:11pm, unable to guide him safely to my house, I told him to stay put, got in my car and met him at a bus stop.

"Man, didn't they give you a map?"

"Yes, I have map."

Aha. The food was cold. I imagined it warm, and it was still uninspiring. Bobby choked on a bay leaf.
author: andy d.

description:
Warm, clean, inviting, brand new location of this local chain of upscale-ish Indian restaurants.  Portions are decent, presentation nice, service friendly.  Prices are $8-14 per entree, and two or three of those plus some bread, rice, or appetizers will fill two people up and send you home with leftovers.

The food was fresh and decent enough but it tasted squeeky clean, not very complex or subtle   You know how it tastes when you brown something on a clean grill or a cast iron pot that isn't seasoned yet?  Like that.  I would give them three stars but it was their first week in operation, before the official opening, and I want to give the kitchen the benefit of the doubt.  Hopefully things will settle in.
author: Gil S.

description:
We ordered take out consisting of 3 kinds of bread: naan, pratha, and chapati. The breads had been made so much earlier in the day they were just kind of rubbery and not much taste difference between them.
We ordered the Traditional Lamb Curry, the Chicken Do Piaza, and the Bengan Bartha. Sauces seemed eerily similar between the chicken and lamb, the eggplant dish was pretty tasty.

The raita was a watered down mess. I love raita, but it is the worst prepared item on most menus - truly watery with little flavor.

The mint sauce was good - but why do I even have to pay for those tiny little sauces?

Not sure this is worth running back to.
author: Mariangela S.

description:
Got take-out from the clay oven (noe valley location) last week, and was disappointed.   It wasn't delivered in a timely fashion, seemed very overpriced for the food portions I got, and there was even a piece of glass/hard plastic in one of my entrees.  I probably won't get take-out from there again.

To be fair, this review is only for take-out from the Noe Valley location.  The dining-in experience might be better, and it might be better at different locations.
author: Dan P.

description:
Some of the worst table service I have ever encountered and I realize waiting tables is a hard job, normally I am fairly easy to please. 

The Clay Oven waiter kept delivering our food to another table. I was brought someone else's check- fully paid with their credit card slipped inside, which freaked me out sine I am paraniod. I ordered a salty lassi and it was not salted so when I brought this to the waiters attention he came back to the table twice to clarify, then my salty lassi came out after we had eaten (he was kind enough not to charge me for it). 

They forgot to service our dessert, we sat around waiting for the waiter to give us attention for maybe 25-30 minutes after eating, while we watched him clear other peoples tables and organize around us- then even after we finally got his attention, he slowly responded since the table clean up of empty tables seemed so much more a priority. 

I (female) was paying for the dinner and ordering the dinner and the waiter seemed focused only on talking with my male companion and thanking only my male companion. It did not seem to be a language issue as much as a cultural issue.

"Thank you sir" 
"Come again sir"
"What would you like sir"
"How is everything sir"

Honestly the food was just OK, but in the future I might skip this place just because of the frustration of dining here.
author: Shannon Z.

description: I very much like this place. Very romantic lighting. Indian music playing which is a plus (some exotic restaurants succumb to the Top40 playlist). The food is great, and the mango chutney is actually the best I've had. I have yet to have a meal here that wasn't good.
author: Giovanna C.

description:
We called in and ordered to go:

Chicken Corma, Lamb tikka-masala, Cucumber Salad, and Aloo Gobhi.

We were so disappointed to find out that even though the delivery was fast all dishes tasted bland, watery sauces, and lacking of flavor.  

The Chicken Corma tasted like they made it out of an old chicken.

The joke of the night was we paid $3.00 for the cucumber salad which was slices of cucumber covered with some spice that didn't add any flavor to the cucumber so it tasted like you took a cucumber out of the frige and cut it into pieces...

You can tell if the food was great if there's left overs and people are asking to take some home... In our case we had plenty of leftovers but unfortunately (I hate to throw away food) nobody wanted to take it home so we tossed it....

Ovreall we paid close to $50 for 3 people.  We all concluded to stick with our good old Indian restaurant...
author: Mr. La Linea ..

description: My family and I had a pleasant experience eating there. The foo we ordered was very flavorful  from beginning to end. It is a very quiet place. The waitress we had was very nice but very quiet. I asked her a question  and it seemed forever to hear her response. All in all it was a good experience as I said and worth going to. It's right off the J Church line if your taking public transportation which is nice.. Parking can be a bit tricky any ware in noe valley. Reasonable too!
author: Creepyfly G.

description: This place has decent food.. and I will Never order from them again. I made the mistake of taking them up on their delivery service. After calling in and waiting for 1 hour and 20 minutes we were told that they had had trouble finding a driver and that the food would take another 20 minutes, that's .. count it..an hour and 40 minutes The worst part is they weren't the least bit apologetic. Turns out they have that retarded mall cop syndrome where they can act like complete idiots and be proud of it. All in all, the service here is beyond dismal. If you want good indian food without the disappointment go to Punjab Kebab House and spare yourself the frustration of this place.
author: Shreya C.

description:
For dinner the other half and I decided to drive down Church St. and see what we felt like eating (neither one of was in the mood to take charge). We found parking right out front, Indian tonight it is.

We ordered chicken masala, lamb and chicken korma, saag paneer, tandoori mixed grill, nan, and basmati rice. Seasoning and taste wise everything was delicious Although the chicken korma I felt was over spiced and the saag paneer is suppose to have chucks of cheese, we had only 3. Although the presentation was beautiful especially when they serve the rice in copper pots. Huge portions, we had enough left over for the following day.

There's a bar off to the side and looking at it I have to assume it's only for wines since I didn't see it stocked with the vodka, gin or other hard liquor.

Walked in and was greeted and seated immediately. Candles were lit for a romantic feel as Indian music played in the background. The walls are a warm curry color with beautiful painted murals in the shape of windows as if you were looking outside. There were few tables for outdoor seating. Service was prompt and friendly. The prices are about $12 each but remember the portions are big.
author: Lola L.

description:
Bunch of friends met here for dinner. Everyone liked what they ordered.
My Tandori chicken so good-not dry. Vegetable Korma to die for!
author: Alan R.

description:
I am really confused by the reviews here. 

First off, reviewing a restaurant that's just opened is like shooting fish in a barrel --- a cheap shot. Of course, things will not be systematized and timing will be off.  It takes awhile to get everything working together. 

Also: A lunch buffet would only be perfect on weekends (hey, don't you ever work?) 

Quality/Bargain: We had the coconut lamb curry and the tandoori chicken --- both excellent  and just hot enough at medium hot --- with basmati rice, cucumber, raita, nan and mango chutney and we spilt a 22 oz. Taj Majal beer.  The total dinner for two came to $36 and change.  We had to double check it.  Hey, that's what we normally pay, each of us!  I love Roti's Indian cuisine, but the check there is more often nearer $100 than not.  

Atmosphere: Pretty pretty pretty! Elegant and romantic. We came late, so no screaming children  [N.B.to one reviewer:  A good way to avoid them is to dine later, like, you know, European adults.].  Positive sign: one of the other tables had real live Brits eating there, which we took as a good sign, as Indian cuisine is as ubiquitous in London and in England generally as Chinese is here.  

Service: Staff was pleasant enough, yet formal [Big plus for not telling me your name and stating the obvious i.e.,  that you'll be our server tonight] and the food didn't take forever.  

As a hoodie, I was thrilled to find that they also do their own home delivery, not Waiters on Wheels.  

A real find.  We'd go back in a New Delhi minute!
